intro: Gibbaeum schwantesii, commonly known as the Schwaner's knobby-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or white, often appearing in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and intense sunlight. Gibbaeum schwantesii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to tolerate harsh conditions.
